questions.question: In what ways can human health be affected by climate change?

choices.answer: Increased food and water borne illness
It can cause or worsen some mental Illnesses

questions.question: How do climate factors (temperature, precipitation, & humidity) relate to vector-borne disease?

choices.answer: Heavy rain increases the risk of animals transmitting rabies
Milder winters increase the tick density & risk of lyme
Dry summers & drought increase the risk of West Nile virus
Snow storms increase mosquito density & risk of malaria

questions.question: How are increasing temperatures & CO2 concentrations expected to affect food & nutrition?

choices.answer: Higher temperatures leads to greater risk of Salmonella
Increases in weeds, insects & fungi require more pesticides
Higher CO2 concentrations lower food's nutritional value

questions.question: Some human health effects of ground level ozone air pollution (a key component of smog) are:
How can human health be impacted by increased extreme precipitation events?

choices.answer: Vitamin D deficiency due to lack of sunny days
Severe flooding can lead to waterborne disease outbreaks
Rapid sea level rise causes more drownings

questions.question: What is increasing the period & intensity of pollination, which increases allergies & asthma?

choices.answer: Increase of CO2 emissions & warmer seasonal air temperatures
Extreme rain refills groundwater for allergenic plant growth

questions.question: Climate change can impact mental health. Which of the following is an example of this?

choices.answer: Overproduction of serotonin from hotter summer days
Increased pressure on the brain from extreme precipitation
Increased seasonal affective disorder from milder winters

questions.question: All of the following are ways scientists study climate change impacts on health except:

choices.answer: Mental health data collection after extreme climate events
National Institute of Health's climate assessment on health
Extensive data on the health in relation to changing climate
Assumptions about human health from watching documentaries

questions.question: All of these preventative measures protect us against climate change except:

choices.answer: Eat a plant-based diet to reduce green house gas emissions
Check your house for molds that causes respiratory problems
Ride your bike or walk for clean energy & exercise
